entry.def: Premeditation is thinking about something or planning it before you actually do it.

example.ex: The judge finally concluded there was insufficient evidence of premeditation.
example.tran: 法官最终作出判定，没有足够证据证明那是有预谋的。

means.word_mean: 1. planning or plotting in advance of acting
2. (law) thought and intention to commit a crime well in advance of the crime; goes to show criminal intent

auth_sentence.content: Magistrate Desmond Nair agreed, saying premeditation can not be ruled out.
auth_sentence.res_content: Magistrate Desmond Nair agreed, saying premeditation can not be ruled out.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Magistrate Desmond Nair agreed, saying premeditation can not be ruled out.

auth_sentence.content: Simple people can also become violent to the point of premeditation when confronted with "unhappy" ideas or thinking.
auth_sentence.res_content: Simple people can also become violent to the point of premeditation when confronted with "unhappy" ideas or thinking.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Simple people can also become violent to the point of premeditation when confronted with "unhappy" ideas or thinking.

auth_sentence.content: The magistrate ruled that premeditation cannot be excluded in the case, but that the charge could be downgraded later.
